taskbody.context: In this section of the lab you will prepare the operating systems of the front-end and Node Controller hosts for the installation of the Eucalyptus software.To ensure proper communication with the Node Controller, the firewall and SELinux on both of your hosts were disabled at installation. However, in a normal installation, you would have to either manually disable these or manually open the Eucalyptus-required ports in the firewall. On the Node Controller host, a network bridge device with a static IP address was configured for you during installation. The name is br0. However, in a normal installation, you would have to configure the bridge yourself.

step.cmd: From your Debian desktop, use Secure Shell (SSH) to log in to the front-end host and the Node Controller host. (If necessary, ask your instructor how to access the Debian desktop and open xterm windows in order to use SSH. Once in an xterm window, you can increase the font size by simultaneously pressing the Control key and the right mouse button, and selecting a larger font size from the drop-down menu.)

info.codeblock: # ssh <front_end_public_IP> -in one xterm window # ssh <node_controller_public_IP> -in another xterm window

step.cmd: On the front-end host, change the root password in order to prevent accidental log in by other students. Change the password to passwordNN, where NN is the number of your student pod. For example, if your instructor assigned you to Pod01, set your root password to password01.

On the Node Controller host, change the root password in order to prevent accidental log in by other students. Change the password to passwordNN, where NN is the number of your student pod. For example, if your instructor assigned you to Pod01, set your root password to password01.
Synchronize the time and date of the front-end host with an NTP server.

info.codeblock: # ntpdate pool.ntp.org # service ntpd start # chkconfig ntpd on # ps ax | grep ntp # hwclock --systohc

step.cmd: Synchronize the time and date of the Node Controller host with an NTP server.

info.codeblock: # ntpdate pool.ntp.org # service ntpd start # chkconfig ntpd on # ps ax | grep ntp # hwclock --systohc
